column5: How do you pronounce Daiwa?  Day-wa? Or Die-wa?
ur second  choice up there lol.
I rarely say it, but I guess I pronounce it die-a-wa. Never gave it a second thought, until now... I'll have to change. I changed how I pronounce Rapala.
I know what you mean with Rapala. You used to put the emphasis on the first syllable? If so, me too.
I pronounce it Die-a-wa too... it doesn't make any less sense then how Bret Favre pronounces his name.
" Die-Wa you no catching no fish!" Use Abu Garcia is what a friend once told me.
Rapala should be pronounced  rrrrapala. In Finnish the R's are rolled and the vowels are not silent.
Bought a new Daiwa spinning reel this winter---better say it right
There is no such thing as an English accent.  There are cockers, scousers, taffs, micks, geordies, etc.....
I have to concede you are right....in a way...but Micks and Taffs would shoot you for suggesting they are English and i have no idea what 'cockers' are...not sure i want to....lol.
A Taff I knew who absolutly loathed cockneys, called them cockers.  Us colonials also didn't like being called "wogs"
LMAO! Boy, some of us are bored tonite.
